pl.bristleback.server.bristle.api

Interface ServerEngine

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConfigurationAware
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ServletServerEngine
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractServerEngine

    public interface ServerEngine
extends ConfigurationAware
    This interface is a most important part of connection module. Main purpose of this module is to handle client connection, including opening and closing handshakes, receiving incoming frames and forwarding them to FrontController and of course sending frames to client. Server engine must properly implements WebSockets protocol by processing the data, decoding and encoding frames. To handle single connections, engine creates object of WebsocketConnector implementation. Server engine use special part of configuration, Engine Configuration. Every implementation should inherit from AbstractServerEngine class, which has more than a half methods implemented.

    Bristleback Server has several built in server engine implementations:

    Server engine name Server engine class
    system.engine.jetty pl.bristleback.server.bristle.engine.jetty.JettyWebsocketEngine
    system.engine.netty pl.bristleback.server.bristle.engine.netty.NettyServerEngine
    system.engine.jetty.servlet pl.bristleback.server.bristle.engine.jetty.servlet.JettyServletWebsocketEngine
    system.engine.tomcat.servlet pl.bristleback.server.bristle.engine.tomcat.servlet.TomcatServletWebsocketEngine

    Created on: 2011-07-05 14:51:41

    Author:
    Wojciech Niemiec

    • Method Detail

      • getEngineConfiguration

        EngineConfig getEngineConfiguration()
        Gets server engine configuration.
        Returns:
        engine configuration.

      • getConfiguration

        BristlebackConfig getConfiguration()
        Gets Bristleback Server configuration.
        Returns:
        configuration.

      • startServer

        void startServer()
        This method is invoked after all server components are in valid initialized state. On that point, server starts to listening incoming connection.

      • stopServer

        void stopServer()
        Stops server, previously closing all open connections.

      • onConnectionOpened

        void onConnectionOpened(WebsocketConnector connector)
        When a new connection is established, a newly created connector invokes this callback method to signal server engine. Engine should always run ConnectionStateListenerChain.connectorStarted() method.
        Parameters:
        connector - newly created connector representing established client connection.

      • onConnectionClose

        void onConnectionClose(WebsocketConnector connector)
        This callback method is called by a connector when connection with client is closed. Connection might be closed for several reasons:
        • Connection is closed by client side
        • Connection is closed because maximum idle time is exceeded.
        • Connection is closed by sending closing server message using ConditionObjectSender.
        Engine should always run ConnectionStateListenerChain.connectorStopped() method.
        Parameters:
        connector - object representing connection with client.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(WebsocketConnector connector,
               String contentAsString)
                 throws Exception
        Sends a text message to a given recipient. If necessary, message should be split into multiple frames. Frame format must be consistent with WebSockets protocol format. Text message has operation code with value 0x01.
        Parameters:
        connector - recipient of the message.
        contentAsString - text message content.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any exception while sending message occurs.
        See Also:
        OperationCode

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(WebsocketConnector connector,
               byte[] contentAsBytes)
                 throws Exception
        Sends a binary message to a given recipient. If necessary, message should be split into multiple frames. Frame format must be consistent with WebSockets protocol format. Binary message has operation code with value 0x02.
        Parameters:
        connector - recipient of the message.
        contentAsBytes - binary message content.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any exception while sending message occurs.
